dialogue: Before I read your proposal, run it past our legal department.
I didn't have to become a corporate lawyer.
I could be a trial lawyer or a judge, you know.
But I chose to work here at this unglamorous position.
Consequently, I have a bad attitude and I'm going to take it out on you.
Your proposal does nothing to help my career.
And if I approve it and we get sued later, then I'll get in trouble.
In a month or so, I'll formally reject your idea with a neatly typed but oddly worded memo.
Did he reject your proposal yet?
And he filed a lawsuit against me.
